entry.title: [Files]: Define the index interface and uses a delegate.
entry.content:
Introduces FileIndex interface. Creates an in memory implementation of

it. Converts FileIndexService to just a facade that relies on the

delegate to implement them. Introduces a method that allows us to add

more terms without removing them. Introduces namespaces, which map to

the field name.

entry.title: Track provisional_frame_for_local_root_swap_ in RenderFrameImpl with a WeakPtr
entry.content:
It's possible for a frame to be detached while in the middle of a

navigation commit on a provisional RenderFrame. See repro test at

third_party/blink/web_tests/http/tests/navigation/resources/reentrant-eventsource-onerror-crash-during-commit-iframe.html.



In this case, if the navigation commits on a provisional RenderFrame,

the provisional RenderFrame will be deleted first, before the previous

RenderFrame. Since we track provisional_frame_for_local_root_swap_

as a raw_ptr in the previous RenderFrame, this hits the dangling ptr

check. To avoid that, track the provisioanl RenderFarme with a WeakPtr

instead. It's ok to do that since if the frame is getting detached

there is no need to do anything to the provisional RenderFrame.



Bug: 936696

Change-Id: I8e855a21b30e2f1fbfb6def712bc29e79ed01ea1

entry.title: Add UMA for deleteing queue directories in missive.
entry.content:
Add a UMA boolean log to track the success/failure of deleting empty multigeneration queue directories. A value of `true` indicates that no errors occurred while attempting to delete directories and that zero or more directories were deleted. `false` indicates that at least one directory that should have been deleted was not deleted due to an error.

entry.title: [FspCache] Introduce map of operation IDs to file handles
entry.content:
Previously, the caller of a CloudFileSystem::OpenFile request would be

returned the file handle created by the underlying FSP OpenFile request.



Instead, the CloudFileSystem should assign a new operation ID upon a

successful underlying FSP OpenFile request. This operation ID will be

returned to the caller and will be used by the caller to communicate

with the CloudFileSystem regarding the opened file.



The CloudFileSystem will still use the file handle to communicate with

the underlying FSP by mapping each incoming operation ID to the file

handle created by the underlying FSP. This mapping will be deleted upon

file close.



The motivation for this change is so that in the future, a unique

mapping can be made between disk backed operations (identified by a disk

FD) and cloud backed FSP operations (identified by a file handle). The 2

operations may return identifiers that clash and any requests for a

clashing identifier would be difficult to disambiguate.



Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystemTest*

Bug: b/328670254

Change-Id: I9884f90ebbbcc6b2e4d1aa2628a79560c98858eb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5354173

Commit-Queue: Cassy Chun-Crogan

Reviewed-by: Ben Reich

entry.title: Link capturing: Fix tab closing for user initiated JavaScript navigations
entry.content:
This CL updates link capturing to only close the captured tab if

the navigation was not from a user gesture within the tab.

This fixes a bug where pages that set location.href = url in

JavaScript in response to a user click were being closed erroneously.



This CL also backfills missing test coverage around the tab closing

code path.

entry.title: [css-scroll-snap-2] Prioritize tree-order among aligned snap targets
entry.content:
FragmentBuilder::PropagateSnapAreas receives the snap areas in sorted

order. By storing them in a vector, this order is preserved in

SnapContainerData's snap areas, so the snap selection algorithm

factors in tree order by default as specified[1].



The change to waitForScrollReset addresses the case where the reset

fails to happen because, given the layout configuration, setting

scrollTop and scrollLeft individually results in noops.



[1]https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9622#issue-2006578282

entry.title: [SWAutoPreload] Make IOBuffer size configurable
entry.content:
This CL makes buffer size for ReadData configurable. As the provided

DataPipeAllocationSize::kLargerSizeIfPossible is too large for android

devices, this CL introduces `read_buffer_size` to decide the buffer

size.



Also, this CL introduce the boolean param, `query_data_size`, which gets

the upcoming data size in advance, and creates IOBuffer with the actual

size. This approach is more reasonable rather than having the magic

number, but it increase the number of DataPipe calls, so implemented

behind the feature param.



Bug: 329014514

entry.title: speculation rules: Diagnose failure to quote URLs in Speculation-Rules header value.
entry.content:
If either the entire value is invalid because it doesn't parse as a

structured field (e.g., `/sr.json`, since tokens cannot begin with a

leading slash) or a particular value is interpreted as a token but not a

string (e.g., `https://example.com/sr.json` is a valid token), then tell

the developer what they likely intended.



This isn't completely exhaustive (hypothetically "?0" could be the URL

of speculation rules, for example), but it should catch 99% of cases of

this bug.



Sample header values and resulting messages:



> Speculation-Rules: /speculationrules.json

Cannot parse Speculation-Rules header value. However,

"/speculationrules.json" appears to be a valid URL. You may need to

enclose it in quotation marks.



> Speculation-Rules: https://example.com/speculationrules.json

Only strings are valid in Speculation-Rules header value and inner

lists are ignored. However,

"https://example.com/speculationrules.json" appears to be a valid URL.

You may need to enclose it in quotation marks.



Bug: 329138750

Change-Id: I55948f2a035e833a98114108dc2aaedae5377b6e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5362742

Reviewed-by: Domenic Denicola

Auto-Submit: Jeremy Roman

entry.title: [css-scroll-snap-2] Fix targeted snap point selection
entry.content:
For a page's main frame, Document::SetCSSTarget is called too late to

let the snap containers know which areas to consider targeted. (So, we

need to queue these snap containers up for an update).

For iframes, it is early enough, which is why the tests that were added

to verify snap point selection with targeted elements pass.



This patch adds a new test, prefer-targeted-element-main-frame.html,

which tests snap point selection with a targeted element without iframes

by opening a new window with a hash fragment and reading the result of

the test in that window via `fetch`.



Bug: 324916797

entry.title: lens overlay: Use WebContentsUserData to glue WebUIController.
entry.content:
This CL is a plumbing refactor with no intended user-visible change.

Previously, WebUIControllers were glued back to LensOverlayController

via a global vector of all LensOverlayControllers. This CL instead

switches to using a WebContentsUserData to perform the same glue.



This CL makes several other small changes:

* Reorders some code so that .cc ordering matches .h ordering.

* Merged lens_overlay_side_panel_coordinator_browsertest.cc into

lens_overlay_controller_browsertest.cc to avoid duplication of test

logic. Also, the previous test was functionally a pseudo-unit test,

the new test is a normal browser test.

* Makes the implementation of CloseRequestedByOverlay asynchronous to

avoid destroying a WebContents during a callback from the same

WebContents.

* LensUntrustedUI is constructed for both the overlay and the side

panel. Moves overlay-specific logic to an overlay-specific part of

LensUntrustedUI, so that it isn't run for the side panel.



Change-Id: Ia25e1397e4e59d403bd598a9628c497bbe613269

Bug: 327506247

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5355570

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: Erik Chen

entry.title: Record delay between FCP frame received to surface embedding in blink
entry.content:
The first contentful paint frame for a new document might be submitted

before or after the surface used for it is embedded by the browser

process. This CL makes us record the delay in both cases, to figure

out how often each case happens and how long the delay is between

the events.

entry.title: Fix LAST_RESORT_SUGGESTION annotation on metrics owners.
entry.content:
This should make gerrit prefer to suggest other owners (either chromium-metrics-review@google.com, or a more specific alias).



The annotation only works on lines assigning directly to users.

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/plugins/code-owners/Documentation/backend-find-owners.html#lastResortSuggestion



Instead

* Move current owners to a METRICS_OWNERS file and annotate all of them LAST_RESORT_SUGGESTION

* Suggest the alias instead in base/metrics/OWNERS

* Reference that when it's "metrics infrastructure".

* Reference METRICS_OWNERS directly for metrics reviews, which should also set more specific owners and "noparent".

entry.title: [BRP/DPD] Support DPD for Scheduler-loop Quarantined objects
entry.content:
Scheduler-loop Quarantine quarantines objects by deferring `Free()`

process, including `PartitionRefCount::ReleaseFromAllocator()` call.

This lowers DPD coverage in the scenario below:



1. `Free(object)` with alive

references. The quarantine stops freeing process before

`ReleaseFromAllocator()` is called.

2. Pointers are released but not detected as dangling because

allocation is not freed yet.

3. The object exits quarantine and actual `Free()` happens.

DPD does not fire because there is no dangling pointer.



This CL adds `PartitionRefCount::PreReleaseFromAllocator()` to keep

DPD coverage.



1. `Free(object)` with alive

references. `PreReleaseFromAllocator()` called before quarantine and

the allocation is marked as "dangling pointer detected".

2. Pointers are released and DPD fires.



Bug: 40287058

Change-Id: I1fe8dbb7a8dc8af98cf8d5e92f74c31038616110

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5294191

Reviewed-by: Keishi Hattori

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271325}

entry.content:
This reverts commit fd4595be405a74afb39bd3e3e79812b21dc9b6c3.





Reason for revert: Causing validation failures in Pixel_Video_Context_Loss_MP4 in pixel_skia_gold_metal_passthrough_graphite_test on Mac AMD.

crbug.com/329121643



Original change's description:

> d3d11: specify texture format and view format in DawnTextureInfo

>

> Skia needs the texture format and aspect to determine the depth buffer

> size. So we have to pass the texture format in DawnTextureInfo.

> This CL only set fViewFormat in DawnTextureInfo for creating promise

> image for a multiplanar shared image, and when the promise image is

> fulfilled, fFormat and fAspect in DawnTextureInfo will be set.

> In future, skia graphite may determine view format based on fFormat

> and fAspect.

entry.title: WebUI: Check-in Lit template *.html.ts wrapper files, part 1.
entry.content:
Checking in Lit's '*.html.ts' files instead of generating them has a

few benefits:

- Eliminates some complications with HTML presubmit checks since

those files were not proper HTML anyway.

- Allows such files to be checked by ESLint and formatted by

clang-format.

- Makes line numbers referenced by TS compiler errors match the

checked-in code.

- Results in less work during the build.



While generating such files during the build eliminates some manual work

needed by WebUI authors, and is more similar to how Polymer based

components are built, the benefits above justify following a different

approach, since Lit templates by nature, significantly blur the lines

between HTML and TS.



The approach above is a middle ground between the Lit team's suggestions

(not worrying/caring about HTML/TS boundaries when using Lit) and

WebUI's current approach of maintaining some separation between HTML

templates and other business logic, while minimizing any complications.



Note that the special '' and

'' comments previously added during the build

have been intentionally removed since they are not needed for

cr_elements/, which can't hold any translated strings anyway.



Bug: 40943652

Change-Id: I026d97d07954fc75fab6f1e5c83f1ecabd437515

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5357277

the error is mostly ignored on all callsites except VaapiVideoDecoder

ones, where it's used to propagate to |init_cb| (which in turn goes

The error type returned in DecoderStatus, which arguably doesn't

apply to all cases where a VaapiWrapper is used, but is generic

enough [1].

VaInitialize() doesn't need to return a boolean, so I removed it).

entry.title: [Extensions] Improve thread safety of RendererAPIProviders
entry.content:
ExtensionRendererAPIProvders are used to initialize different script

contexts as they are created. Since these script contexts can be

created either for the main thread (as in the case of a page-based

context) or on worker threads (e.g. for a service worker-based

extension's background context), the API providers are used on

multiple threads (potentially concurrently).



This is safe because:

* The API providers are created when the main thread starts, before any

worker threads could be created.

* The API providers are owned by the Dispatcher, which is in turn owned

by the ExtensionsRendererClient, which is a singleton object that is

leaked. Thus, the API providers are never destroyed once they are

created.

* The API providers owned by the dispatcher are never modified through

either assignment or methods.



The last point was true, but not enforced. We can enforce this by:

* Making the collection of API providers on the dispatcher const

(ensuring no API providers are added or removed once the

Dispatcher is constructed).

* Making each provider within that collection const (ensuring no

method called on the API provider modify state within that API

provider).

* Making each method on the API provider const (to be compatible with

the point above).



These help ensure the thread-safety of accessing these variables on

multiple threads in the renderer.



Bug: 326903574

Change-Id: Ib52f88ec0f589ff62f2622fc66f7637b6253386d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5342718

Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

Commit-Queue: Devlin Cronin

Reviewed-by: Ovidio Ruiz-Henr√≠quez

entry.title: [Benefits][Settings] Clear benefits when benefits toggle is turned off
entry.content:
This CL addresses the card benefit toggle state change event. When the

toggle is switched off, it updates the kAutofillPaymentCardBenefits

preference to false. The PaymentsDataManager monitors changes in the

kAutofillPaymentCardBenefits preference state. Upon detecting a change,

it triggers the OnAutofillPaymentsCardBenefitsPrefChange method, which

clears all benefits if the preference is set to false.



This CL refactors the benefit clearing process, moving it from the

PersonalDataManager to the PaymentsDataManager.

Adds PaymentsDataManagerTestApi.

Removes the ClearAllCreditCardBenefits method from the PDM.



Design: go/pay-autofill-chrome-benefits-design

entry.title: [Panorama] Hide overflow-x
entry.content:
A horizontal scrollbar is showing at minimum width.



There seems to be an extra width on #container. The extra width goes

away with the removal of border-box, but then we get double vertical

scrollbars. I removed the overflow: auto on #container to handle it

instead. It will use the styling of .sp-scroller instead, which sets

overflow-x to hidden.



Also, removed GM2 margin-bottom (it was being overridden by the GM3

style below it so it went unnoticed) that was accidentally left in.

entry.title: [Extensions] Fix crash key length for worker ID set.
entry.content:
Crash key names cannot be longer than 40 characters. This limits them

for these crash keys to 40. A DCHECK enforces this so we are

occasionally losing some of the crash key data until we fix this.



Low-Coverage-Reason: HARD_TO_TEST We can't reproduce multiple workers,

but this CL will help us get closer to being able to do that.

entry.title: [Extensions] Update "blessed" context naming to "privileged" instead
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/5074899 updated extension context enum types referring to

"blessed" contexts to instead describe them as "privileged", however

some of the comments and variables around these still use "blessed".



This CL updates those comments and variables to use the "privileged"

term. There may still be a few more lingering ones around, but this CL

should cover anything using it with "extensions" in the file path.



Note: a followup will also need to be done in the actual bindings and

feature system to update the uses of "blessed" in there. "BLESSED" is

also used in debug strings used in

extensions/renderer/script_contxt.cc, as well as some associated

histogram names, but those will be more involved to change should we

want to.



No behavior change is expected.

entry.title: Add ReadAndDiscard option to URLLoader
entry.content:
Add a new URLLoader option which requests that it read and discard the

response body itself rather than writing it to a data pipe. This is more

efficient when the consumer doesn't need the body. The URLLoaderClient

will be passed an empty data pipe handle in OnReceiveResponse().



The new option is only implemented for network::URLLoader. Because there

are over 500 implementations of URLLoaderFactory::CreateLoaderAndStart()

it is not possible to implement the option in all of them. Instead,

implementations of URLLoaderClient must be prepared to receive and

discard a body even if they requested the option.



The option is currently disabled when ORB is enabled as we don't need it

in that case and it complicates the implementation.



Add a feature flag "SimpleURLLoaderUseReadAndDiscardBodyOption" which

causes SimpleURLLoader to set the kURLLoadOptionReadAndDiscardBody

option when creating a URLLoader in the DownloadHeadersOnly() method. If

the URLLoader supplies no body in this case the body is considered to be

successfully downloaded.



Modify SimpleURLLoader's unit tests to test all three cases of flag

enabled, flag disabled, and flag enabled but the option not implemented

by the URLLoader.



Also add a fieldtrial testing config for the feature flag so that it

will be enabled in browser tests to give additional coverage.



Change-Id: I1d609f679334f8650dac27a51bfc90ec972c784c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5348681

Reviewed-by: Takashi Toyoshima

Commit-Queue: Adam Rice

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271270}

entry.title: ash: Fix post_login_deferred_task_runner_ DCHECK
entry.content:
`post_login_deferred_task_runner_` is started when waiting

for shelf icon animation in http://crrev.com/c/5348944.

However, browser tests often has shelf created first then

simulate user logins. This causes the unexpected sequence of

events. That is, ScheduleWaitForShelfAnimationEndIfNeeded first

then LoggedInStateChanged. When this happens, we will have

post_login_deferred_task_runner_ started and the login animation

timer running. And on slow bots, the timer fires and causes

the DCHECK. This CL ignores such case for test.

entry.content:
When working with a LSP for starlark, the LSP server runs `bazel info`

on the root directory, and it requires MODULE.bazel{,.lock} files in

order to recognize the root directory as a bazel workspace. Add these

files to ignore since they are only useful for devs who need a starlark

LSP (e.g. working on infra/config code).

entry.title: Do not use BGRX on Android for ChromiumImage
entry.content:
Android uses AHardwareBuffer backing which does not support BGRA/X

format. So disable the code for Android.



The conditions for using BGRX in drawing_buffer is already fairly

complex and arbitrary, and this is just adding to the complexity until

shared image support / capabilities can be sent to clients

declaratively.

entry.title: webauthn: flesh out PIN support somewhat
entry.content:
* Get a wrapped PIN from the security domain and remember it when

registering.

* Store only a single wrapped PIN in the enclave state, rather than a

map of security domain epoch to wrapped PIN. We don't support secret

rotation so far, and so this was excess unused complexity.

* Teach the UI to prompt for the PIN when needed and send it to the

enclave for validation.

to fall back to the on-demand API that optimization guide provides.

This will only be called if the user is known to have visited the URL

that is being queried. In our case, this currently corresponds to open

tabs but will also reference sync entities in the future.

entry.title: LinkPreview: content::WebContentsDelegate::ShouldIgnoreWebInputEvents
entry.content:
This patch introduces WebContentsDelegate::ShouldIgnoreWebInputEvents

interface to the content public API for ignoring input events

directly. This change is needed because views::WebView is so special

that it escapes from existing event routing mechanisms in ui/.



We already had a similar API, WebContents::IgnoreInputEvents().

But this can be used only for ignoring all events while the obtained

scoped objects live. This is not enough for LinkPreview purpose as

we need to ignore specific kinds of events selectively.



WebContentsDelegate::ShouldIgnoreWebInputEvents takes a const

blink::WebInputEvent& and the delegate can decide if the processing

event should be ignored. Other events, such as focus events, or

ui::Events dispatched in WebContentsView, still call the old checker,

ShouldIgnoreInputEvents() without any event information, and they are

controlled via WebContents::IgnoreInputEvents().



As an initial audit implementation for LinkPreview, we permit

only page scrolling related events through the introduced API.



Change-Id: I2e32fac801d27e7f148b4a662a4989b732dcd3a4

Bug: b/328343480, b/329147054

are able to read the isClosing() state off of Tabs and omit them from

the meta file.

entry.title: Performance Tooling for cross-execution context PostMessaging
entry.content:
This change implements performance tracing for post message dispatching and handling events between the main thread, iframes, and dedicated workers.



We use the tracing macros helpers alongside other helpers to capture relevant trace data at various event dispatch and handling times and send the trace event to the frontend for processing and linkage.





[Design Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/14v-muPKa4ylStxY4qlDi7KFWGEZkad-9j5jo9-FTAf4/edit?usp=sharing)

if sub managers are enabled always return true. This CL removes that

function and all of its use-cases. This helps clean up callsites

of the Synchronize() flow a lot more.



Future CLs will remove the other functions from OS integration

entry.title: [Extensions] Stop killing service worker renderer for kBadRequestId.
entry.content:
Before this change we would kill a service worker renderer whenever we

had a record of the message in `unacked_events_` and attempting to

finish the external request for it returned

`content::ServiceWorkerExternalRequestResult::kBadRequestId`.



After this change we no longer kill the renderer because it is possible

that a new worker could finish starting before an ack IPC for a previous instance of the worker has been received and processed by the browser.



This will get tested soon, but are difficult to replicate due to the

complicated IPC timing that must be achieved in the test.



Bug: 40072982

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Fix edge-case with linear-mapped scoring of doc suggest.
entry.content:
When enabling one of the linear-mapped scoring variants (conservative,

moderate, or aggressive), it looks like the existing implementation of

ML scoring will naively assign a final score of "min + ml_score * (max

- min)". However, this means that stale suggestions sourced from the

DocumentProvider cache, which normally have a traditional score of zero,

would be assigned a non-zero relevance score and thus get surfaced to

the user via the Omnibox popup.



Since this results in a subpar user experience (see screenshots), this

CL fixes this behavior by ensuring that we don't score any stale

suggestions using the linear-mapped ML scoring variant. This ensures

that users do not see any DocumentProvider suggestions which are

irrelevant with respect to the current Omnibox input.



BEFORE: http://screen/3zK25nppxkhdCYb

AFTER: http://screen/9RepjgfFSjmt8Fi



Bug: 40062540

Change-Id: I11389dda9602fda2ca0f0ead945bcd2cd446cfa1

entry.title: Re-introduce span::operator==
entry.content:
This allows spanification to change `memcmp(ptr, ptr, size) == 0` to

become simply `span == span`.



The operator differs from std::ranges::equal in a few ways:

- It's much simpler to type/find.

- It fails comparison of fixed-size spans that have different sizes

at compile time (similar to in Rust) instead of returning false

at runtime.



The operator differs from memcmp() in a few ways:

- It's not a three-way comparison, which can be added later.

- It allows comparison between spans of different types, as long as

the types are comparable (they satisfy the concept

std::equality_comparable_with).



This operator was previously removed in 03fe4779b619e78b since the

operator was removed from std::span, in order to ease transition from

base::span to std::span, however that is no longer our plan, as we are

extending span in many ways to make it work better for spanification

at scale.



Unlike the previous implementation of the operator, it now supports

implicit conversions to span. This allows comparing spans with other

things that can become a span, such as arrays, including implicit

const promotion in the conversion.



The removal of the operator== and operator<=> greatly increased the

verbosity of code that had been using them before.



Notably absl::Span still has the operator, and this will be useful

for making spanification easier for codebases that are built on

absl, and this change helps make things at least as easy for Chrome.



While much has been said on the regularity of types, I just straight

up disagree that view types should suffer from API challenges based

on this, and that their regularity should be invalidated based on the

fact that C++ allows aliased mutation. View types should be treated

as regular under the assumption that the backing store they point to

is not invalidated while they are in use. Academics aside, this will

greatly simplify how spanification changes are written that involve

comparison.



Bug: 40284755

Change-Id: Ida57c6e890bafa26e30eb0b3ca2ad286d7b8790f
